questions.question: What had opposition to certain federal powers?
What did Hamilton's financial plan call for?

choices.answer: paying off the national debt gradually
having the states assume the national debt
raising money by asking for foreign aid

questions.question: Which is not a right guaranteed under the Bill of Rights?
Which of the following issues and events did not challenge George Washington and the new nation during his presidency?

choices.answer: the creation of an independent judiciary
putting the nation's finances in order
creating a written plan for the new government

questions.question: Which of the following points did George Washington make in his Farewell Address?

choices.answer: The United States should remain neutral.

questions.question: Who negotiated a treaty to resolve the continuing problems with the British?

choices.answer: Secretary of the Treasury Alexander Hamilton

questions.question: Washington did what - farmers challenged the authority of the new federal gov't with "Whiskey Rebellion"?

choices.answer: encouraged citizens to buy the product
asked Thomas Jefferson to meet with the unhappy farmers to resolve the prob
used the authority of the federal government to put down the rebellion

questions.question: On which of the following issues did Thomas Jefferson and Alexander Hamilton disagree?

choices.answer: powers of the federal government provided in the Constitution

questions.question: Why did political parties develop during Washington's administration despite his opposition to them?

choices.answer: There was a clear difference of opinion about federal and state power.
Plantation owners felt their interests would not be protected without them.
This was the only way to keep the British out of the United States.

questions.question: When Washington became president, New York City was the capital. What happened to change that?

choices.answer: Washington wanted the capital to be in a place named for him
Hamilton agreed to move the capital to the South to gain support of $ plan
Jefferson wanted the capital moved to Richmond, but he was outvoted.
